title: What are some examples of technology in healthcare? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology has become a foundational aspect of our lives. It complements human intelligence in a beautiful way, allowing us to achieve more with the information we have. Following are some examples of technology enhancing healthcare: Drug development:Technology is almost as clever as a human being, but it can process information much faster than our brains. As such, the new technology can analyze large datasets and to identify connections and patterns researchers could never detect. This research are a great help in discovering new drugs against deadly diseases. Disease Detection:Technology has played an important role in the diagnosis of certain diseases. Depression is a big threat to global well-being, affecting hundreds of millions all over the world. However, AI-based apps can successfully track and evaluate user behavior, thus discovering the first signs of mood swings and depressive behavior, for Instance, BioBeats. And there are many other such apps are available to monitor blood pressure, steps taken, and other psychological conditions. Technology has already to detect skin cancer more accurately than dermatology experts. Namely, the system analyzes thousands of skin cancer images and combines these insights with the existing documentation to determine whether it’s really melanoma or not. Securing Privacy Of Patients:The huge revenues of the healthcare industry have also attracted a lot of scammers and fraudsters as well. The cybercriminals steal medical insurance data of anyone and use it to avail or sell off further medical procedures like buying drugs and getting medical tests done in labs. So deal with this issue AI-powered SaaS products are helping the insurance companies and hospitals to provide KYC services that can be used in this sector to keep identity theft at bay by means of facial recognition that supports only live face detection and by document verification. These digital KYC systems use advanced AI and HI (Human Intelligence) to pick up fraudulent attempts. All of these innovations are leaving us awestruck and leaving us with a question which is: Can AI really take over the Healthcare Industry in the next 10 years?
